name: Qerajo
strategy:
select(P, O, S, M):-
    \+ holds(last_move(O, _LMo), S),
    holds(default_move(P, M), S).
select(_P, O, S, Mo):-
    holds(last_move(O, Mo), S).
game_rules:
:- discontiguous player/2.
:- discontiguous role/2.
:- discontiguous control/2.
:- discontiguous did/2.
:- discontiguous goal/2.
:- discontiguous outcome/6.

% Payoff matrix for Chicken Game
payoff('straight', 'straight', -10, -10).
payoff('swerve', 'straight', -1, 1).
payoff('straight', 'swerve', 1, -1).
payoff('swerve', 'swerve', 0, 0).

% Initial state
initial(s0).

% What holds initially: who is a player, their role, and whether they can play.
initially(player(d1), s0).
initially(player(d2), s0).
initially(role(d1, row), s0).
initially(role(d2, col), s0).
initially(control(d1), s0).
initially(control(d2), s0).
initially(default_move(_, 'swerve'), s0).

% When a state is final: no need to check content as it is generated by game/2,
% implying it is a legal state.
final(do(move(_P2, _M2), do(move(_P1, _M1), S))):- initial(S).

% A legal move is a possible move where the player has control (i.e., it is their turn).
legal(move(P, M), S):- possible(move(P, M), S), holds(control(P), S).

% What is possible for a player to choose
possible(move(P, 'straight'), S):- holds(player(P), S).
possible(move(P, 'swerve'), S):- holds(player(P), S).

% Moves that are opposite to each other.
opposite_move('swerve', 'straight').
opposite_move('straight', 'swerve').

% The effects of a move: if P has chosen M, then in the next state this
% is what they did.
effect(did(P, M), move(P, M), _S).

% The effects of a move: once a move is made, the player loses control, i.e.,
% cannot move anymore.
abnormal(control(P), move(P, _M), _S).

% What holds finally: the outcome with players, Moves, and Utilities.
finally(outcome(P1, M1, U1, P2, M2, U2), S):-
    final(S),
    holds(role(P1, row), S),
    holds(did(P1, M1), S),
    holds(role(P2, col), S),
    holds(did(P2, M2), S),
    payoff(M1, M2, U1, U2).

% Goals achieved by the players.
finally(goal(P1, U1), S):-
    finally(outcome(P1, _, U1, _, _, _), S).
finally(goal(P2, U2), S):-
    finally(outcome(_, _, _, P2, _, U2), S).
